website_summaries.verdict: A great tool for the price, but consumers say that this will wear out quicker than pricier units.
pros: The price is great and the 8" tool clips through thinner wires with ease
cons: Spend some more money if you want a tool that will hold up to a lot of use and abuse

customer_reviews.title: Made in America!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a 7" diagonal cutter I had for 30 years after I inadvertently cut into a live electrical wire. I love the fact that this tool is made in America. It works well. Missing, though, is the refinement of finish of my earlier tool. I guess this is what it takes for an American company to survive competing against the Chinese. But you should choose to buy it. It should last a long time and you are keeping jobs in America.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA. " I dont think so Tim".
customer_reviews.text: I am very skeptical about these side cutters being made in the USA .I have a pair of original Channellock No 337 7-inch side cutters that I have had for years and they are light years ahead in quality and workmanship than what was sent to me in the post
customer_reviews.author: ivan Vegar

customer_reviews.title: Classic American made tool.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts wire with ease. Nice hefty steel. Comfortable handles. Only con is the finish of the tool is poor. While this does not affect the performance of the tool in anyway. A $10.00 diagonal cutter from overseas can have a better finish. The poor finish is why I gave product 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Antibot

customer_reviews.title: USA made and what one can expect from Channellock
customer_reviews.text: First pair is about 25 years old. It's dulled from all the stuff cut over this years though not abused. This newer leverage point makes cutting much nicer. Had pulled trim off for a floor replacement and some of the 18 ga. brad nails along with other finish nails were refusing to come out with the pry bars. These cut through them easily. Hands still hurt after a couple hours from this task but much easier with these. Next time I get some young kid to cut the nails down. ;) Happy with this purchase it makes the job easier which is efficient. Also debated the Knipex but wanted a USA tool.
customer_reviews.author: M. F.

customer_reviews.title: excellent side cutters.
customer_reviews.text: I use this tool to cut steel washers off of VW drain plugs for my job as a lube tech. In order to remove the factory washer to install a 1 time use crush washer you need strong Side Cutters that can cut a steel washer using only the tip of the Side cutters. So far these are the best side cutters I have found. You need a really strong grip to cut through the washer but if you are strong enough these will cut a framing nail or a steel washer like a hot knife through butter all day long for years.
customer_reviews.author: Baeofeng Enthusiast.

customer_reviews.title: crusty junk, off to HF next time
customer_reviews.text: hot garbage. edges are easily sharp enough to draw blood, and not the cutting edges. Ground surfaces are rough enough to use as a file. hinge is way too tight, need 3 fingers to open them up, might as well use both hands. The pile of pliers on the bottom shelf of HF have superior finishing. I was hoping for something in between german made and chinese junk, instead got hot garbage at middle of the road price.
customer_reviews.author: compnerd

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: They are what I purchased the only problem I have if you wanna call it that is they’re too sharp I’m a carpenter and I bought them mostly for pulling trim nails and staples and with hardly any pressure they cut! If you’re buying them to cut wire these are for you but for my needs I’ll have to wait for them to ware out before they’ll be good for carpentry!
customer_reviews.author: BRIAN C MILLER

customer_reviews.title: Channellock 338 8-inch Diagonal Cutting Pliers
customer_reviews.text: After reading many positive reviews of Channellock products I decided to buy these. I wanted pliers with good steel and heat treating so the cutter edge will last better than the generic cutters I bought for my first tool box. Those generic mini pliers rusted and froze up too quickly. These 8-inch channellocks offer better leverage and they came to me with a well oiled hinge and marked Made In USA too. I am confident these will hold up to a lot of use on all types of electrical wire. The plastic trays for my Stanley sockets have instructions showing where to use cutters like these to open them so they can be snapped closed afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality set made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a quality set but one small detail will make these my back up pair. The tip is blunt and makes them less usable in certain situations in my pine of work. However I'm happy I purchased them as they're made in the USA and supports domestic jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Atom

customer_reviews.title: Rough Finish
customer_reviews.text: The finish is real rough and not complete. Not to worry I worked in a machine shop, I know how to de burr metal products, but I would really expect more from an American company. I still admire them for keeping the product made in USA and competing with the Chinese companies, and American companies that have defected to a cheaper labor market. Unable to comment on Durability, but they work very well when new
customer_reviews.author: My65442

customer_reviews.title: It slices, it dices!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best dikes I've ever used by far. It's one of those tools you don't want to short change. I have cut things with these that sounded like a bad idea at the time. Most other cutters would be chipped or dulled by now with what I've put these through. But these things are legendary. I'd be willing to bet they're just as good as a similar tool from the expensive red brand. If you're trying to carefully put together a really nice tool set with quality stuff, or you're out for the best bang for the buck replacement, give these a try. They might be the last ones you ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: MoonBandit

customer_reviews.title: Questionable product
customer_reviews.text: After reading some reviews and receiving a pair for myself I’m not sure if it’s genuine or not. Right of the bat I can see that it’s not proportional from side to side. It’s like it wasn’t cut right or something. I did test them and they do cut but I’m suspicious.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: Channellock Quality
customer_reviews.text: I own several Channellock products. They last forever. I bought the diagonal cutters to remove finish nails from wooden moldings. They get up nice and tight to the wood surface.
customer_reviews.author: 4NNOTHX

customer_reviews.title: These are an inexpensive "Made in the USA" replacement set.
customer_reviews.text: My old cutting pliers recently developed deformations on the cutting surfaces. These are an inexpensive "Made in the USA" replacement set. Feels good in the hand. The tool packaging did not have any warrantee info, so I checked their website. "Tools are not warranted against abuse or wear from faithful service". I have other Channellock items accumulated over the years, and have been happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C

customer_reviews.title: They do not seem to have to same cutting force ...
customer_reviews.text: They do not seem to have to same cutting force as i would have expected and what is up with the flattened nose. as i often need to select a wire in a bundle of wires these will not work well for me. I will keep them for around the house but will get a pair of klein's for work.
customer_reviews.author: Vapor

customer_reviews.title: So far I'm quite impressed
customer_reviews.text: Nice set of side cutters for my shop. Seem to be high quality and the snip end is pretty tough, haven't had any problems thus far. I'd say if youre looking for a quality pair of snips you really cant go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: GameFiend

customer_reviews.title: Gaaahhhhhhbageee
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with no QC issues, they just wore out way too quickly and now they don't even cut zip ties. Bought a pair from Harbor Freight - they weren't great either but they at least were cheap. Get Kleins or Irwins (NWS) and don't look back.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: Cut really good
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good diagonal cutter...easy to use and fits my hand. Glad I found these....I had lost my favorite pair and really needed something for my home workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Camera Bug

customer_reviews.title: The tip is ground off.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! The tip is ground off. I contacted the manufacturer and got a smart mouth that told me tough cookies. I went to Klein. Must have the tip in electrical work.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Laidig

customer_reviews.title: Because Channellock!  What else?
customer_reviews.text: Channellock's are Great Tools. I've never had any of them fail me. Highly Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Darb

customer_reviews.title: Some of the best side cutters you can get
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best side cutters you can get. Should last for years & years! Especially if taken care of(like not used for bunch of dumb shuffit). My last pair got lost somewhere, not sure where (22 year old daughter or boy friend), but those were like 20 years old anyway. Blue handles were like almost black! Ex price too here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Borne

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: Functional set of dikes, handle isn’t the most comfortable but not bad. All these pliers are a dime a dozen. These will do just about anything you need them too from cutting wires to medium cables.
customer_reviews.author: Braeland

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: They are definitely lighter than the same ones from 15 years ago or so my dad has. But they so far after a few months of cutting metal rivets and other things seem to be holding up just fine. And my no means am being gentle. Great tool as reliable as can be so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Best cutters ever.
customer_reviews.text: I know of no better cutter available at any price. These are the ones you want. Trust me. Keep them away from your coworkers or else buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: J. Toll

customer_reviews.title: Steel only ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought the about a year ago. They worked ok for about 40-50 cuts. They they got dull with visible nicks the blades. Not the same quality steel they used to be, that is for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Burrs cleaned up nicely with sandpaper but hardness of steel in some question ...
customer_reviews.text: Channellock 337 similar to the old model, but instead of made in Meadeville, PA, is stamped "MADE IN USA". Chrome finish darker than original and edges were rough with sharp burrs. Burrs cleaned up nicely with sandpaper but hardness of steel in some question inasmuch as sanding would cure the defect. Cutting edge and Grips good, but hardness of cutting edge still a question.
customer_reviews.author: John R. Bachtel

customer_reviews.title: It is as good as the brand's reputation
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new set of wire cutters and these had a good reputation. I also use them with fishing line and their cutter design is as good as its reputation. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: So Cal

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: for 16 bucks its very good. I've seen people reviewing ones from china for $4 so take your risk if you want. It worked good for me so I am keep ing it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Fuchs

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality - not what I know of Channellock
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality- gap at cut edge. Sharp edges, poor tip finishing - What happened to Channellock quality
customer_reviews.author: SPURSEL

customer_reviews.title: Great equipment
customer_reviews.text: The cutting tip broke off the first time I was cutting a piece of fence wire. I had to switch to an old pair to finish the job. It would appear that the steel is too brittle for moderate work. UPDATE: Channellock replaced the pliers free of charge and I shipped the defective ones back. Must have been a bad run because the new ones have been up to the quality standard I've come to expect from them. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C. Tewksbury

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: these a well made with a good hardend cutting edge that I use on thick cables. as always glad to support american made tolling.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy mustain

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers made in USA they cut nice and neat.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good to buy
customer_reviews.text: Good to buy. I brought two of these side cutter. Both are super tight. Sometime even hard to open. After I spray some wd-40. It’s quite smooth now. I generally use this for cut string of CAT 5e or 6 cable and marked the cable. One thing I need to mention , cut wire ability is not the strong point than my Irwin. Hard to cut wire like 12mm 3 core tps. My Irwin combination 215mm pliers cutting power is neat and precise.
customer_reviews.author: kenny.g

customer_reviews.title: Materials are good quality, but sharp burrs along edges of ground surfaces.
customer_reviews.text: The pliers work fine, the jaws mesh well, but the finishing is very poor--there are very sharp burrs along all the outside edges of the jaw where they were ground... Not the type of quality I'm used to seeing from Channellock... hopefully this is the exception and not the rule.
customer_reviews.author: Old Geezer

customer_reviews.title: Snip w/Confidence
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality. USA made is a +. The right tool for the job is appreciated because so many physical accidents are the result of using an improper, dull, or weak tool. I've only had one opportunity to use this Plier. I knew with the 1st "snip" that I had made the right choice. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Tom j Dolan

customer_reviews.title: Fair set of pliers.  Works, but not pro quality
customer_reviews.text: They are okay but quite tight. Makes it hard to open your plier with the back of your fingers when you are working. Slows you down. Fairly sharp and aligned but nowhere the quality of the great era of American tools.
customer_reviews.author: Barry A. Hudson

customer_reviews.title: NO BETTER SIDE CUTTER
customer_reviews.text: There is no better hand tools thanChannellock, the cutting pliers are no different. Cuts clean with minimal effort, well made.Well worth the price for a long-lasting tool, I will probablt lose it before it breakes, LOL
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Completely rusted over after one night outside
customer_reviews.text: These work just fine but one evening I left them outdoors where I was working. They completely rusted over.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. This one is a bit longer than what I am used to. But if access is no problem, you have a lot of leverage with this, and it leaves a good clean cut.
customer_reviews.author: Paul H.

customer_reviews.title: Small
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected and probably not acceprable for heavy duty jobs.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Typical quality
customer_reviews.text: Channellock are the best tools made in the USA. I paid about $5 more than a cutter from a big box store for a tool that will last a lifetime and allow its makers to live and prosper.
customer_reviews.author: Nikolai L

customer_reviews.title: Channel Lock dikes are the best.
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money and time with less expensive Diagonal Cutters. These are the best. They cut all sizes of wire and welding rodswith no problem
customer_reviews.author: Crazy at the Beach

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: cut as they should and the joint is not loose, i’m happy with channel lock quality
customer_reviews.author: Shaun S.

customer_reviews.title: Sharp and Precise
customer_reviews.text: My old diagonal cutting plier was dull after my wife used it for cutting tile so I bought this one. It is big enough and sharp enough to cut a battery cable if you apply enough effort.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Very heave duty and extremly sharp!
customer_reviews.text: I should have ordered these years ago. I've been beating around my old Craftsman sidecutters for 30 years. What was I thinking. This is a GREAT product. I like the longer handle.
customer_reviews.author: chuck J.

customer_reviews.title: Sharpness
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be able to cut small rope cordage close to a knot, without leaving much tail. They aren't sharp enough to do that job well. I'm sure that they work to cut wire fine. Otherwise, they are well built.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Anne

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a friend because he always was using the ones I had. Don't compare to the old green handle
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Bates

customer_reviews.title: good channellock tool
customer_reviews.text: Nice cutters. I bought these for work. I work on wire braiding machines. These are good quality for the price. Less than half the price of klein which are industry standard. I have other channel lock tools and the quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: kindale

customer_reviews.title: Rust is a issue with these.  But I am also rough on stuff
customer_reviews.text: Keep them outside in Indiana. Held up .still sharp rusted a little .but good deal and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Big worm

customer_reviews.title: Knock off
customer_reviews.text: It's not genuine channellock. The top is a pair of store bought pliers, bottom is this item. The logo on all real channellock items look like the top one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin meyer

customer_reviews.title: Love the Blue Handles
customer_reviews.text: Good cheap diagonal cutters. Can be used as hammer or nail puller. Hehe. Cheap enough that I won't cry when I leave them somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Frattaroli

customer_reviews.title: I was pretty rough on these and they really don't care
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. Long handle gives plenty of leverage. Cutting surface shows zero sign of wear so far
customer_reviews.author: Doug Marke

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.
customer_reviews.text: I use the quite often in diesel truck repair and maintenance, works flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Wilder

customer_reviews.title: Channels cutter pliers
customer_reviews.text: Channelock quality as usual. Just in time for assembly of Autumn door wreath.
customer_reviews.author: Hook

customer_reviews.title: Legit
customer_reviews.text: Item description is exactly what I was looking for. Overall satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Tredneck

customer_reviews.title: Blunt tip and uneven.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible!! Tip is grinder flat and uneven! Can’t reach in between tight areas due to the blunt tip. Very disappointed with this product! Poor quality. Don’t buy tools to save a couple bucks.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Delmark

customer_reviews.title: Old-fashioned goodness
customer_reviews.text: Channellock has always been my favorite tool. These match my 30-year-old diagonal tool perfectly .
customer_reviews.author: patsi

customer_reviews.title: American made, top quality.  Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Top quality, made in USA. Excellent value for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore Shasta

customer_reviews.title: Best diagonal cutters on the market.
customer_reviews.text: I love these. The only reason I had to buy another one was that my old one just disappeared somewhere. I love these cutters.
customer_reviews.author: Bob S

customer_reviews.title: Jaws don't line up, and too small for my hand.
customer_reviews.text: The pivot pin appears to be off center, leaving the jaws loose and off-line. Can't be adjusted. The other Channelock items I purchased at the same time were of expected quality. The E41S diagonal cutter, at only 4", felt more agile in my hand than this tool at 4.5", so I might have returned it anyway as a poor fit for me. The 5" 435 cutter was just right.
customer_reviews.author: sueboe

customer_reviews.title: Feel sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Use them everyday. Ive had them a few months and they haven't loosened at all.
customer_reviews.author: DieselDan

customer_reviews.title: Nice Feel and Nice Cuts
customer_reviews.text: Misplaced my cutters I have had for 30 years. Hoped buying new ones would cause the old ones to show up. Not so far! Anyway, great quality and after one days use, turned around and bought a second pair for my son.
customer_reviews.author: WJ from Utah

customer_reviews.title: Check that USA quality
customer_reviews.text: ok, but not like olden days of channel lock products.......
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Quit being cheap and get some quality tools. It is worth it......
customer_reviews.author: angella marie

customer_reviews.title: A great pair of snips
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying Channellock tools for years, and I will keep buying the Channellock brand. These snips are high quality, and hold an edge exceptionally well.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho resident

customer_reviews.title: Love the Channellock brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought a lot of Channel lock tools, they still are making quality tools. These cut very well and just have a good feel about them.
customer_reviews.author: James Colvin

customer_reviews.title: The metal is not as hard as I would have ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal is not as hard as I would have thought. The copper has put some small dents in the sharp edge. Otherwise its works well.
customer_reviews.author: D. Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just what I expected from Channellock a great American made product. Will last me my whole life.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Always used Klein but value of channel lock switched me over.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great set of dikes
customer_reviews.text: I love these things. I am a farmer and I built a lot of fence for my cattle and these things just keep cutting. I finally broke down recently and bought a new set after 5 years. These are a little longer than the other ones but they work fine. Put them in your pocket and you're ready to go cut some wire
customer_reviews.author: 3 amigos

customer_reviews.title: Money well spent
customer_reviews.text: These cutters are bulletproof. The blades are undamaged after cutting many stainless steel springs. I have owned cheaper cutters, they are not worth the cost savings. Buy these Channellocks... you will not be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: The long handles make for easy operation but also make it harder to reach tight spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Typical channellock. I expect a lifetime of use from them.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Professor Doctor

customer_reviews.title: Cutters
customer_reviews.text: These are the 8in snips perfect size for handling any job
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great, long lasting hard working crimpers. 10th set or so..for my workers and me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality tools at low prices..American made.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first pair of large sized diagonal cutters that I've ever owned right out of the package...I couldn't resist the excellent price for a brand name, American made tool. I'll be spreading the word to my Union brothers and sisters. Thank you. All the best in 2015
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Brunswick Jr

customer_reviews.title: quality tools
customer_reviews.text: Nice fit and finish. A step up from Craftsman. Not quite Knipex and certainly not SnapOn, but good value for the money. Made in the USA.
customer_reviews.author: HAP

customer_reviews.title: Great pliers. Would buy them again Used to cut ...
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers. Would buy them again Used to cut hog-ring clips. Work very well for that type of work.
customer_reviews.author: Dwayne Rioux

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pliers - well made and very good quality. Also a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: If you need a good pair these are it
customer_reviews.text: Channellock still has the same old quality, IF you need a good pair by channellock. 69 year old master mechanic.
customer_reviews.author: Alpha L Moore

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable
customer_reviews.text: Like everything I've used from Channellock, these cutters are great! The knife anvil cutters cut so much more cleanly than many other types of cutters. The joint is placed as close to the jaws as possible, and it really makes cutting easy. The slightly tapered handles are comfortable to hold.
customer_reviews.author: Owen Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased a couple of sets of the cheaper tools at both Home Depot and Lowes. The pliers are OK, but, I've broked the wire cutters from both sets. I'm slowly replacing everything with Channellock tools. They cost a little more, but, I'm not worried about busting my knuckles or cutting a finger.
customer_reviews.author: W. Barnett

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great snips, I bought this pair to replace the ones I misplaced
customer_reviews.author: TLM

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of Dikes for the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this product before but they were misplaced.Im an electrician and I find these dikes to be completely capable of what I need them for in the field.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Well made American Tool
customer_reviews.text: Well made American Tool. Heavy in hand is a good thing. The metal is finished and polished to a very high quality. Why buy a cheap tool that doesn't work that well, won't last and will end up in the garbage? Answer: No reason. Just get a well made tool and you are set...job well done Channellock!
customer_reviews.author: billm FD3

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love me my channellock pliers and adjustable wrenches, this dykes is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Made in the U.S.A. !
customer_reviews.text: Well, Channellocks are the Cadillac of hand tools and this one is no exception. It is well made, very ergonomic and cuts through anything. And best of all, it's made in the good 'ol US of A. Costs a bit more but worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Twinboom38

customer_reviews.title: A name you can trust "Channellock"
customer_reviews.text: As I stated before about Channellock brand pliers, they are the best any one can buy in my book. I have several pair of Channellock brand pliers.
customer_reviews.author: Donald A. McGaha

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived and solid
customer_reviews.text: It was more than the other options, but I am happy I sprung for the Channellock -- I see where the money went. I can't comment on reliability. I will report back if I have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: John Nehls

customer_reviews.title: Only the best
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size, good price, work as expected. I only use Channellock tools, the quality can't be matched. I highly recommend all Channellock pliers, dikes, slip joint etc.
customer_reviews.author: Mark in Pa.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent wire cutters
customer_reviews.text: Solid tool which cuts through wire and plastic easily, and is quite nice to hold. Would definitely recommend as a solid choice for wire cutters.
customer_reviews.author: wolfboy001

customer_reviews.title: These are great tools.  PERIOD
customer_reviews.text: I own about 25 different Channelock pliers, side cuts, needle nose, etc. Just great quality all around.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Schroeder

customer_reviews.title: Tool cuts great and American made but if you like your tools ...
customer_reviews.text: Tool cuts great and American made but if you like your tools to look good this tool has uneven grinding and has very sharp edges. Klein cutters are better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Channellock 338 8-Inch Diagonal Cutting Plier
customer_reviews.text: I like many people thought have multiples of the same tools but I didnt have this specific size etc...but I allways wanted my own (always been places or worked for others and they were around) . They are perfect, excelalnt tool for the price as well I ordered (3) different Channellock pliers sets that I wanted and cross referenced the prices with the big box stores including shipping it still came out cheaper to order online rather than pay NYC prices + sales tax. So it was a good deal if you order a couple units.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Whittaker

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice product, solid build, good quality, I have been enjoying using these.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sohm

customer_reviews.title: Love this tool and have been using this specific type ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this tool and have been using this specific type and brand for years. Having to replace old pair because helper dropped them on concrete and the tip broke but the wee 2yrs old and had heavy usage.
customer_reviews.author: phillip

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very surprised these pliers lived up to the reviews. Work perfectly and as stated.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica S.

customer_reviews.title: Spendy, but oh so fine, made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find 8-inch diagonal cutting pliers locally. Most of them are only 7-inches. I like the leverage provided by the extra length, that and the precision fit of these pliers makes them so nice to use. It's a pleasure to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Lookout Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Best Wire Cutters Period.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace a lost pair that some archaeologist might find someday. Same quality as the 30 year old ones. Nice to see a company still on top of quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allan S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use these every day at work, 7 months and counting, cutting tie wraps, wire, and nails. The edges are still straight and sharp. The jaws are strong. ---UPDATE--- It's May 2015, and these dykes are still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: jomammah

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to use
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy to add to the tool box to compliment use with my 6" Craftsman. Has a Made-in-USA electroetched on the side and the price was comparable to imported hand tools.
customer_reviews.author: DHH

product_meta.title: Channellock 338 8-Inch High Leverage Diagonal Cutting Plier | Knife and Anvil-Style Cutting Edge is Laser Heat-Treated for Extended Tool Life | Forged from High Carbon Steel | Made in the USA
product_meta.description:
Size:8-InchChannellock 338 8-Inch High Leverage Diagonal Cutting Plier | Knife and Anvil-Style Cutting Edge is Laser Heat-Treated for Extended Tool Life | Forged from High Carbon Steel | Made in the USA

AMAZON.COM


Not all cutting edges are the same. The 8-inch Channellock 338 Diagonal Cutting Plier uses precision machined knife and anvil style cutting edges to ensure perfect mating and superior cutting edge life. Channellock uses high carbon C1080 steel for superior performance on the job, and an electronic coating for ultimate rust prevention. It's completed by Channellock's iconic blue handle, which is both comfortable in your hand and easy to spot in your tool bag.

High leverage cutter with lap joint diagonal
(view larger). The 338 can cut piano wire (0.063- to 0.091-inch thick), hard wire (0.047- to 0.091-inch), medium hard wire (0.047- to 0.091-inch), and soft wire (0.162-inch maximum diameter).

Channellock utilizes precision-machined knife and anvil style cutting edges to ensure perfect mating and superior cutting edge life. While most manufactureres use two sharp edges that can become misaligned and lose their cutting effectiveness, Channellock's knife and anvil cutters give you proper cutting edge alignment for a clean cut every time. The edge is also laser hardened for unprecedented edge life.

SPECIFICATIONS
Overall length 8 inches Jaw length 0.79-inch Joint thickness 0.43-inch Handle span 1.89 inches Joint width 1.18 inches Cutting edge 0.79-inch Weight 0.66 pounds ABOUT CHANNELLOCK
Founded in 1886, Channellock is a worldwide leader in the manufacture of high-quality pliers and assorted hand tools. Now run by the fifth generation of the DeArment family, Channellock tools reflect a tradition of dedication to excellence maintained for well over a century. Over the years, Channellock has obtained several patents including one in 1965 for the conical surface created on the cam side of the pliers when undercut and another in 1984 for the PermaLock fastener found in its Tongue and Groove Pliers. Channellock still manufactures more than 120 different sizes and types of pliers and hand tools at its facilities in Meadville, Pennsylvania.

338 8-INCH DIAGONAL CUTTING PLIER
AT A GLANCE
 * Cuts piano wire, hard wire, medium hard wire, and soft wire
 * Knife and anvil style cutting edge to ensure perfect mating and superior cutting edge life
 * Laser heat-treated cutting edges last longer
 * Constructed of high-carbon C1080 steel for superior performance
 * Iconic blue handle is comfortable and easy to spot in your tool bag 
 * Made in USA


Channellock tools are obsessively designed down to the smallest detail (view larger). 

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
This cutter is a perfectly mated cutter, heat treated to hold it's edge. The pliers has polished high carbon drop forged steel and the Channellock Blue comfort grips. They are 100 % guaranteed against breakage and failure.
